sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In northeastern Greece, hundreds of firefighters are tackling wildfires that have been burning for a fortnight, while flooding has blocked roads in Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Belgian government says it can no longer offer housing to single male asylum seekers, as it needs to prioritise families.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Evros, in north-eastern Greece, firefighters are still trying to contain wildfires that have been raging for 14 days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to the fire service, it's still burning between the villages of Yanouli and Kournoufolios, while Soufli appears to be safe from the flames at the moment. On Friday, the firefighting effort involved 129 fire engines with a crew of 586 members, 16 teams of firefighters on foot, supported by six firefighting aircraft and two helicopters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Austria, floods that have been affecting the Tyrol region since Monday have cut off connections between Reer Ottsdal and Intal due to a 50-metre hole in the main road connecting the two valleys.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The road should be back in service on Saturday after a makeshift repair.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The worst hit area is Runhof, where eight homes have been flooded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Belgium is temporarily banning the sheltering of single male asylum seekers, as the government says the country is short of space.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It says priority will now be given to families.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the capital Brussels, activists and migrants took part in a demonstration denouncing the government's decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They described it as inhumane.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The asylum seekers say they'll have little choice but to sleep on the streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The government has not given a timeframe for lifting the ban on housing single males.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Supporters of Serb nationalist Milorad Dodik, a pro-Russian leader, marched in the Republika Srpska area of Bosnia on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They were demanding a stop to what they say is a criminal prosecution of their leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Carrying Russian flags with pictures of Vladimir Putin, Serbs demanded that the Bosnian state prosecutor removes its indictment against Dodik.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Bosnia has charged him with defying decisions made by the international official overseeing peace in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The red carpet was rolled out for Pope Francis as he met Mongolian President Ukhna Khorel Suk, who was wearing a traditional deal tunic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's the first papal visit to Ulaanbaatar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Fettered in the morning with an official welcome ceremony and honour guard, the Pope is visiting a country with fewer than 1,500 Roman Catholic citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's understood Catholics from neighbouring countries have travelled to be there for the Pope's visit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The mass ranks of Mongolia's honour guard, descended from the warriors of Genghis Khan, served as a reminder of the country's strategic location between China and Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Pope will also visit Ulaanbaatar's cathedral.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The summer holidays are coming to an end for school students across Europe, but it will be a new term with a difference for some. In France, two schools were destroyed in riots over police tactics. It means 55 pupils from La Verriere, west of Paris, will start term on Monday in a different school.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Poland, the new school year comes amidst protests by teachers demanding a 20% pay rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Friday, 3,500 teachers, education workers and parents took part in a national demonstration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It is clear that education is at a great turn, at a huge turn. The question of how we will get out of this turn is also a question of the future of Polish students, the future of education, the future of education workers. And it all lies in our hands. In Serbia, there's an increased focus on student anxiety following the school shooting in Belgrade

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: in the summer.
